I understand that you may have concerns about the safety of genetically modified foods, and it is certainly understandable to be cautious in the face of uncertainty. However, it is important to note that the scientific consensus is that genetically modified foods are safe for human consumption and that there is no evidence to suggest that they pose significant long-term risks to human health.

Additionally, much of the research on genetically modified foods has been independently funded and conducted by respected scientific institutions and organizations, including the World Health Organization (WHO), the U.S. National Academy of Sciences, and the European Union.

That being said, it is ultimately up to individuals to make their own decisions about what they eat, and there is no harm in choosing to avoid genetically modified foods if that is what makes you feel most comfortable. However, it's important to base your decision on reliable sources of information and to consult with health professionals if you have any questions or concerns.
